vehicles.description: A black SUV is parked on the left side of the road, facing the direction in which the vehicle is traveling.
vehicles.explanation: The position and stationary state of the SUV might affect the driving route of this vehicle, requiring it to maintain a safe passing distance.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Two pedestrians are standing on the right side of the road.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: It is necessary to reduce speed or come to a complete stop to avoid a collision.

traffic lights.description: The traffic light visible in the distance ahead is displaying a red signal.
traffic lights.explanation: The vehicle must be prepared to stop at the intersection or remain stationary until the traffic light turns green.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the traffic image observed, there is a black SUV parked on the left side of the road, facing the direction in which it is traveling. The SUV could influence the vehicle's driving path, necessitating the maintenance of a safe distance while passing by. Additionally, two pedestrians are noticed standing on the right side of the road. This necessitates a reduction in speed or a complete stop to prevent any potential collision with them. Furthermore, there is a traffic light in the distance displaying a red signal, indicating that the vehicle must prepare to halt at the intersection, or remain stationary until the signal turns green. Other categories such as traffic signs, traffic cones, barriers, and other objects are not present in this traffic scene.

driving_suggestion: Immediately reduce speed, and be prepared to stop if necessary, to allow pedestrians time to remove the dog from the road. Pay attention to the SUV on the left, ensuring that it remains stationary as you pass by. Although the light is green, proceed with caution, giving priority to the immediate danger posed by the dog and pedestrians.

1.description and explanation: This is a dog standing on the road. The presence of an animal on the road poses a potential hazard to traffic. The driver of the vehicle should slow down and be prepared to stop to allow the dog to move safely out of the way. This situation requires the driver to be attentive and cautious to prevent any harm to the animal and to maintain road safety.
